channel.title: ::pickup Help...? LO0k
channel.description:
In my narbscape based server most of the commands dont work. there in client.java and they should work but when i type them in it just dont i tired replacing them but no luck...
please help ( i dont want to reinstall i worked to hard for that)

item.title: ::pickup Help...? LO0k
item.dc:creator: @ginger_ninja ginger_ninja
item.description:
@ginger_ninja wrote:

just place replace your pickup with this one…

 if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights >= 2)) {
            try {
                int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
                int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));

                if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                    addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
                } else {
                    sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist");
                }

Read full topic

item.title: ::pickup Help...? LO0k
item.dc:creator: @Get_Forgotten Get_Forgotten
item.description:
@Get_Forgotten wrote:

if you would actually ‘Read’ it you would realize the code he needs help with is the pickup command with does infact spawn items into your bag Don’t quite understand what else you could possibly need to know… just go look into a working source and rip it out of that one… pretty simple…

item.title: ::pickup Help...? LO0k
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Uhmmm… It’s sort of difficult to help someone with commands if they dont tell you what commands wont work ^.^ lol. its pretty important to know the rights needed, if ur codes are right (put a coding example up) and what kind of code they are… like an item spawning code, teleporting code… stuff like that. repost something that would help us, otherwise, its gonna be pretty hard.

Read full topic

item.title: ::pickup Help...? LO0k
item.dc:creator: @Javaftl Javaftl
item.description:
@Javaftl wrote:

One, Are you admin :O(nuby question), Two, Are you spelling them right?
And you’re title say’s ::pickup help, for command’s you just type name name, not ::pickup before it, and example of pickup would be ::pickup 00995 1 or ::pickup 0995 1
This was an easy answer o:

Read full topic
